OrderAck.description: A response to an order; communicating acceptance, rejection, or an amendment

Meta.description: Information used for internal purposes at SPS Commerce

Bulk-Import.description: For use with the Invoices, OrderAcks, OrderChanges, OrderChangeAcks, Orders, or Shipments schemas only

CrossDock.description: For use with the Invoices, OrderAcks, OrderChanges, OrderChangeAcks, Orders, or Shipments schemas only

DropShip.description: For use with the Invoices, OrderAcks, OrderChanges, OrderChangeAcks, Orders, or Shipments schemas only

InventoryAdvice.description: For use with the ItemRegistries schema only

ItemManagementService.description: For use with the ItemRegistries schema only

LogisticsManagement.description: For use with the CarrierLoadTenders, MotorCarrierFreightDetails, or CarrierLoadTenderResponses schemas only

MultiStore.description: For use with the Invoices, OrderAcks, OrderChanges, OrderChangeAcks, Orders, or Shipments schemas only

None.description: For use with the OrganizationalRelationships schema only

PlanningScheduleRelease.description: For use with the PlanningSchedules schema only

ProductActivityReport.description: For use with the ProductActivities schema only

SalesOrPriceCatalog.description: For use with the ItemRegistries schema only

SmallPackage.description: For use with the CarrierStatusMessages schema only

StockRelease.description: For use with the Orders or Shipments schemas only

StockTransfer.description: For use with the Shipments or WarehouseTransferReceiptAdvices schemas only

Truckload-LTL.description: For use with the CarrierStatusMessages schema only

TradingPartnerId.description: Unique internal identifier defined by SPS Commerce which identifies the relationship

PurchaseOrderNumber.description: Identifying number for the purchase order assigned by the buying organization

TsetPurposeCode.description: Code identifying purpose or function of the transmission

04.longDescription: Used when updates are made to a previous transmission, but not when the entire document is replaced. For example, a change could be an update to a header level date, or a line item quantity

05.longDescription: Used when the document should be treated as a full replacement of a previous transmission

20.longDescription: Indicates the finalized version of the document and that no additional updates or changes will occur

CN.longDescription: Used by the ordering party to indicate that an order is complete and should not be further fulfilled, or by the order recipient indicating that they have fulfilled the order to completion.

PrimaryPOTypeCode.description: Code indicating the specific details regarding the ordering document

26.longDescription: Code used to indicate the order is for replacement parts only. This is not the same as replacing the original order.

BH.longDescription: Used when the product should not be shipped, but allows for the revenue to be recorded

CF.longDescription: A type of order that has been discussed verbally or through other means of communication between a buyer and seller

CN.longDescription: An order in which the sender retains ownership until goods are sold by the consignee

EO.longDescription: A type of order being used to get the items to their destination no matter what the cost

IN.longDescription: A type of order that is sent for informational purposes. If used, the order should not be fulfilled

NP.longDescription: An order placed to introduce a new product offering

RO.longDescription: A type of order to urgently be fulfilled, but still continues to go through the normal process of completion

TS.longDescription: Used to indicate the shipment of goods to an intermediate location(s), then to the final destination, often for the purpose of changing the means of transport.  Note: Cross Docking is similar to and in certain cases can be considered a specific form of transshipment; however, transshipment is a broader term that can also encompass other instances of shipping to an intermediate location.  Use KN: Cross Dock where applicable.

WO.longDescription: Used when a product that is under warranty is defective and needs to be replaced.

PrimaryPOTypeDescription.description: Free form text to describe the specific details regarding the ordering document
examples: This is a test. Do not ship

items.description: This group should be used if the associated normalized fields already contain information.

POTypeCode.description: Code indicating additional details regarding the ordering document

26.longDescription: Code used to indicate the order is for replacement parts only. This is not the same as replacing the original order.

BH.longDescription: Used when the product should not be shipped, but allows for the revenue to be recorded

CF.longDescription: A type of order that has been discussed verbally or through other means of communication between a buyer and seller

CN.longDescription: An order in which the sender retains ownership until goods are sold by the consignee

EO.longDescription: A type of order being used to get the items to their destination no matter what the cost

IN.longDescription: A type of order that is sent for informational purposes. If used, the order should not be fulfilled

NP.longDescription: An order placed to introduce a new product offering

RO.longDescription: A type of order to urgently be fulfilled, but still continues to go through the normal process of completion

TS.longDescription: Used to indicate the shipment of goods to an intermediate location(s), then to the final destination, often for the purpose of changing the means of transport.  Note: Cross Docking is similar to and in certain cases can be considered a specific form of transshipment; however, transshipment is a broader term that can also encompass other instances of shipping to an intermediate location.  Use KN: Cross Dock where applicable.

WO.longDescription: Used when a product that is under warranty is defective and needs to be replaced.

POTypeDescription.description: Free form text to describe the additional details regarding the ordering document
examples: This is a test. Do not ship

PurchaseOrderDate.description: Date the purchase order was created

PurchaseOrderTime.description: Time the purchase order was created

ReleaseNumber.description: Identifying number for the purchase order relating back to the original blanket order

AcknowledgementNumber.description: Identifying number for the acknowledgement assigned by the acknowledger

AcknowledgementType.description: Code defining the vendor's status of the order as well as how much detail is being provided in the acknowledgement

AH.longDescription: Used to indicate that the order will not be fulfilled at the requested date, and no detail is provided as to when it will be fulfilled. There will typically be another acknowledgement sent at a future date stating when it will be fulfiilled

ShipCompleteCode.description: Code to identify a specific requirement or agreement of sale. Should only be used to indicate if an item can be placed on backorder

Y.description: Back Order if Out of Stock

InternalOrderNumber.description: ERP generated number assigned as unique identifier for each incoming order

InternalOrderDate.description: ERP generated internal date for each incoming order

AcknowledgementTime.description: PO Acknowledgement Time/Original Requested Ship Time

ExchangeRate.description: The rate to be applied to convert one currency to another

Department.description: Name or number identifying an area wherein merchandise is categorized within a store

DepartmentDescription.description: Free form text to describe the name or number identifying an area wherein merchandise is categorized within a store

Vendor.description: Number assigned by buyer that uniquely identifies the vendor

JobNumber.description: Project number assigned to a standard reorder purchase order

Division.description: Different entities belonging to the same parent company

DocumentVersion.description: Used to communicate the version number of the current document

DocumentRevision.description: Used to communicate the revision number of the current document

TermsType.description: Code identifying type of payment terms

18.description: Fixed Date, Late Payment Penalty Applies

23.description: Payment Due Upon Receipt of Invoice

TermsBasisDateCode.description: Code identifying the beginning of the terms period

TermsTimeRelationCode.description: Code relating the TermsBasisDateCode to a date, time, or period

10.description: End of week containing the reference date

6.description: End of month containing the reference date

7.description: End of month following the month of reference date

8.description: End of quarter containing the reference date

9.description: End of year containing the reference date

TermsDiscountPercentage.description: Terms discount percentage available to the purchaser if an invoice is paid on or before the TermsDiscountDate. Percentages should be represented as real numbers[0% through 100% should be normalized to 0.0 through 100.00]

TermsDiscountDate.description: Date by which payment or invoice must be received in order to receive the discount noted

TermsDiscountDueDays.description: Number of days by which payment or invoice must be received in order to receive the discount noted

TermsNetDueDate.description: Date by which total invoice amount is due[discount not applicable]

TermsNetDueDays.description: Number of days until total invoice amount is due[discount not applicable]

TermsDiscountAmount.description: Discount amount available to the purchaser if an invoice is paid on or before the TermsDiscountDate

TermsDeferredDueDate.description: Date by which the payment is due if terms have been deferred

TermsDeferredAmountDue.description: The monetary amount which the payment is due if terms may have been deferred

PercentOfInvoicePayable.description: Percentages should be represented as real numbers[0% through 100% should be normalized to 0.0 through 100.00]

TermsDescription.description: A free-form description to clarify the terms
examples: Must be paid in full by end of year

TermsDueDay.description: Numeric value for day of month

PaymentMethodCode.description: Indication of the instrument of payment

PaymentMethodID.description: Used to communicate the data of the PaymentMethodCode

LatePaymentChargePercent.description: Indicates that this is the percentage applied to a base amount used to determine a late payment charge

TermsStartDate.description: Date from which payment terms are calculated

TermsDueDateQual.description: Code identifying the method to be used for payment in conjunction with due date

AmountSubjectToDiscount.description: Monetary amount upon which the terms discount amount is calculated

DiscountAmountDue.description: Amount due if all discount terms are met

DateTimeQualifier.description: Code specifying the type of date

036.longDescription: Date when something is no longer available/valid

076.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested delivery

077.description: Requested For Delivery Week of Date

087.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested shipment

100.longDescription: The date at which there is no shipment arrival timeline

110.longDescription: The date associated with the initial scheduled ship date

145.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is first available for business

146.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is no longer available for business

209.longDescription: A date on which the funds are at the disposal of the beneficiary or cease to be at the disposal of the ordering customer

371.longDescription: The expected date of receiving a good or service

405.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is created or manufactured

511.longDescription: Date when a product can not be legally sold due to it being unfit for use or consumption

636.longDescription: The most recent date at which an update was made to the transaction

ACT.longDescription: The date at which the document is effective for terms and contractual agreements

BBD.longDescription: Date when a product's optimal use or consumption has lapsed but is still legal for sale

CAD.longDescription: Date the item was added to the trading partner's internal catalog

CSD.longDescription: Date that the contract was signed. May be different from the date the contract comes into effect.

DLO.longDescription: The date and time related to loading cargo

MRB.longDescription: Indicates that the return document must be sent by the provided date or time

OTD.longDescription: The date when ownership of the goods change

POS.longDescription: Used to indicate the date/time that equipment was/must be in position (typically used to communicate when an empty trailer or container must be in position for loading a shipment)

TPD.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is taxed, typically seen with VAT

Time.description: All standard XML formats are accepted.

DateTimePeriod.description: A date, time, or range of dates and times

ContactTypeCode.description: Code identifying a type of contact

HM.longDescription: Who to contact regarding inquiries or emergencies for a hazardous load

MRP.longDescription: Person or persons responsible for monitoring material availability [MRP]

SC.longDescription: Point of contact for shipping information

TIC.longDescription: Point of contact for technical information

items.description: This group should be used if the associated normalized fields already contain information.

AU.longDescription: The Defense Switched Network (DSN) is the primary system of interbase communication for the U.S. Department of Defense

EX.longDescription: An additional telephone set that is connected to the same telephone line

FT.longDescription: A long-distance telephone network serving the civilian agencies of the United States federal government

ContactID.description: The value of the identified contact

ContactReference.description: Additional field to clarify a contact

items.description: Represent an entity such as an organizational, physical location, property, or individual

AddressTypeCode.description: Code identifying an organizational entity, a physical location, property, or an individual

BOWN.longDescription: Party who owns the brand of the item[s]

BY.longDescription: Party who is purchasing the product and/or service, but is not necessarily initiating the order

CQ.longDescription: Used to indicate the location of the business's headquarters

DS.longDescription: Party who purchases goods, promotes and resales those goods to retailers at a markup or fee

ESIID.longDescription: 17 or 22-digit number used to identify a unique point of electric service delivery to a home or business

FR.longDescription: Used primary on reporting documents where there is no buyer or seller

FW.longDescription: Also called Freight Forwarder, or Forwarding Agent

N1.longDescription: Party which must be made aware of a shipment arriving at a location. Typically used with imports/exports

OB.longDescription: Party who initiates an order for goods and/or services, but is not necessarily purchasing it

PATI.longDescription: A location of a person receiving or registered to receive medical treatment

PLCO.longDescription: A location where goods enter the marketplace of the importing country

POAR.longDescription: A location where goods enter a country but may not require passing through customs

PODI.longDescription: A location where goods are unloaded

POEN.longDescription: A border crossing where persons and/or goods legally [via customs] enter a country

PW.longDescription: Location in which the shipment will be picked up from

RAMP.longDescription: A location where repair and maintenance is administered

TO.longDescription: Used primary on reporting documents where there is no buyer or seller

TS.longDescription: Transfer point between different carriers or between different vehicles of the same carrier

LocationCodeQualifier.description: Code identifying the structure or format of the related location number[s]

10.description: Department of Defense Activity Address Code
10.longDescription: A six position code that uniquely identifies a Department of Defense unit, activity or organization (DoDDAC)

33.longDescription: A five character identification assigned by the Department of Defense's Defense Logistics Agency used as a standardized method of identifying a given legal entity at a specific location (CAGE)

BE.longDescription: The standard address location code for a specific equipment location as used in the telephone industry

D.longDescription: Classification of U.S. Customs districts and ports for which shipments are reportable

K.longDescription: Classification of foreign ports by geographic trade area and country from the Maritime Administration

TPL.longDescription: Location number assigned by a third party who was not involved in the buying cycle and is different than the buying and selling location numbers

AddressLocationNumber.description: Unique value assigned to identify a location

AddressName.description: Primary free-form textual description of a location

AddressAlternateName.description: Additional free-form description of a location

AddressAlternateName2.description: Additional free-form description of a location

State.description: Code[Standard State/Province] as defined by appropriate government agency

PostalCode.description: International postal zone excluding punctuation and blanks[Zip Code for United States]

Country.description: Human readable description identifying the country

LocationID.description: Provides further description to the address information. This can be either text or an ID

CountrySubDivision.description: An administrative division such as a subnational entity, constituent unit, or country subdivision

AddressTaxIdNumber.description: Unique number assigned by the relevant tax authority to identify a party for use in relation to Value Added Tax[VAT]

AddressTaxExemptNumber.description: Unique tax exemption number assigned by the relevant tax authority to identify an entity or organization

ReferenceQual.description: Code specifying the type of data in the ReferenceID/ReferenceDescription

02.description: Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication
02.longDescription: A unique identification code for a particular bank

12.longDescription: Account number in a trading partner's accounts receivable system

19.longDescription: Different entities belonging to the same parent company

5D.longDescription: Identifies and describes the type of credit line in use

AI.longDescription: Any invoice numbers in relation to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AN.longDescription: Any PO numbers in relation to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AO.longDescription: Number assigned by the buying or logistics organization approving the delivery, routing, or pickup of the shipment. This is not the tracking number

AOAC.longDescription: Any order acknowledgement number related to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AOCH.longDescription: Any order change number related to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

ARE.longDescription: Any release number in relation to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AUED.longDescription: Used to communicate an Export Declaration Number [EDN] issued by the Australian Customs Service

AWB.longDescription: Non-negotiable transport document issued by an airline for information relating to ownership, contract of carriage, and receipt of goods

AY.longDescription: Authorization number supplied by a finance company prior to shipment of product

BAF.longDescription: The reference value that is provided to the sender/shipper that indicates a parcel has been handled off to the carrier

BL.longDescription: A document that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage and is a receipt of goods that has been issued or approved by a government official

BM.longDescription: A shipper assigned number that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage and is a receipt of goods

BT.longDescription: Identification number assigned to a specific group of products from the same production cycle for tracking or accountability purposes

CAN.longDescription: Used when individual accounts have been consolidated

CN.longDescription: Reference number assigned by the carrier

CRM.longDescription: Reference number that relates a credit memo to an invoice

CT.longDescription: Reference number of an agreement concluded between parties.

CUDN.longDescription: ID assigned to a shipment or package by the government when customs paperwork has been completed

D3.description: National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy Number
D3.longDescription: Identifier assigned by the National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy (NCPDP)

D5.longDescription: A number given during the dyeing process to identify what vat the material was colored in

DIP.longDescription: Number identifying a debtor-in-possession (DIP) [a debtor-in-possession is a person or corporation who has filed for bankruptcy protection but still holds property that a creditor has a right to]

DJ.longDescription: The reference value that correlates to the proof of delivery of a parcel

DK.longDescription: Number that indicates what loading or receiving bay should use at the trading partner's facility

DNN.longDescription: The number relating to a document that proves a shipment was successfully received. Often times this document requires a signature, and if so, the accompanying date will be when the note was signed.

DRRN.longDescription: Value that indicates the version of a design, primarily used in communications to a manufacture to ensure that the correct part or item is created

DRWN.longDescription: Identifies a technical design or drawing. This number is retained across all versions of a design. Any revisions are communicated with a separate revision number (see DRRN qualifier)

EF.longDescription: Number assigned by a bank to reference or trace a payment

ENGC.longDescription: Value indicating a change has been made in the specification of a part

ENGN.longDescription: Identification number marked on the engine block [i.e. Car, Motorcycle]

ES.longDescription: Identification number used by U.S. exporters to electronically declare their international exports

EWC.longDescription: Code used to identify waste as listed in the European Waste Catalogue

FL.longDescription: Number issued by a federal government agency, assigned to a provider of service that practices business under the agency's purview

FR.longDescription: A bill rendered by a carrier for freight charges applicable to a shipment

FW.description: State or Provincial License Identification Number
FW.longDescription: Number issued by a government agency, assigned to a provider of service that practices business under the agency's purview

GC.longDescription: Reference number of an agreement concluded between a company and a government agency

GP.longDescription: Priority rating number assigned to a contract as defined by the Department of Commerce

GRN.longDescription: Unique account number assigned by a retailer to a person or persons [gift, bridal, baby, etc]. Typically seen with dropship.

GT.description: Goods and Service Tax Registration Number

HC.longDescription: A unique code stamped on metal that relays the manufacturing and origin information

IMEI.longDescription: Unique identification number used for mobile phones

INV.longDescription: Unique identifier assigned by the billing party

KAN.longDescription: Identification number associated with the related Kanban card

LF.longDescription: The location on a factory or plant's assembly floor where the product should be delivered

LO.longDescription: Number that represents the loading, unloading, capacity and overall total volume of a shipment. Typically seen in Logistics

LT.longDescription: Identification number that is a specific portion of a production run in order to track specific equipment or material used during the process. Multiple lots can make up a batch

MB.longDescription: Value that groups multiple BOLs together [most common when one order has multiple ship to's]

MC.longDescription: Number used to identify what roll or frame of microfilm should be used or looked at

MS.description: Manufacturers Material Safety Data Sheet Number
MS.longDescription: Reference number of an official document outlining what a specific product is made up of. This is mainly used for safety in regards to hazardous chemicals, but extends to storage, handling, etc. This is maintained by an organization which is independent to each country

OA.longDescription: Number assigned by the buying or logistics organization approving the delivery, routing, or pickup of ocean freight. This is not the tracking number or lading number.

OB.longDescription: A document that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage, and acts as a receipt of goods for overseas shipments

OC.longDescription: An identifying number of a container which is transported via ship. Typically used for imports

OD.longDescription: A unique code for returns to identify the order details [RA/RMA]

P4.longDescription: Used to indicate the associated project number

PAN.longDescription: Used when a change to an account number has been made and the previous number needs to be reported

PD.longDescription: Number uniquely identifying an agreement for a special offer or price

PK.longDescription: Number that identifies the packing list or slip. Not intended to be used as a indicator that a packing list is required, or a summary of the content on the list

PKY.longDescription: A unique identifier provided to licensed users of a software program

PL.longDescription: Version of a price list/catalog from which the related item's price was obtained

PPGP.longDescription: Used to indicate when items of an order or shipment should be grouped together for packing when there is no Master SKU. Generally a simple number or letter combination that is non-distinct

PRSH.longDescription: Unique identifier of the price sheet that the item is listed on

Q1.longDescription: Identifying number associated with receiving an estimate on services or merchandise

Q1B.longDescription: Value to identify a revised quote number

RL.longDescription: The secondary or backup location on a factory or plant's assembly floor where the product should be delivered

ROL.longDescription: A number indicating what specific roll the flooring originated from

RSN.longDescription: A non-binding reservation number for product not yet purchased

RU.longDescription: Identifying number assigned by a carrier or logistics department to a pre-planned route or to a required series of transportation links

SCHN.longDescription: Used to indicate the sales channel from which the order originated

SDR.longDescription: Used to communicate or return the partners revision number when the normalized field is used or not available

SDV.longDescription: Used to communicate or return the partners version number when the normalized field is used or not available

SE.longDescription: Number that uniquely identifies a specific item

SI.longDescription: Identification number assigned to the shipment by the shipper that uniquely identifies the shipment from origin to ultimate destination and is not subject to modification

SL.longDescription: Code indicating a geographical region used to identify sales

SLI.longDescription: An unique number for the line item[s] which is generated from the seller's system

SRE.longDescription: The last serial number value of a series of serial numbers

SRS.longDescription: The first serial number value of a series of serial numbers

TAN.longDescription: Used to communicate the membership number of a organization in a industry specific 3rd party group [i.e. National Costume Association Number]

TJ.longDescription: Also called a TIN, this qualifier is used to communicate the taxpayer's identification where required by law

TPF.longDescription: Number used or provided by a partner who is not involved in this transaction set for shipping charges

TPP.longDescription: Method of payment used by a partner who is not involved in this transaction set. Typically used to communicate end consumer information for packing slips

USED.longDescription: Used to communicate an Export Control Classification Number [ECCN] issued by the US Bureau of Industry and Security

V3.longDescription: A unique number assigned by a shipper or ship owner that links a ship or vessel to a trade route and is normally not reused

VT.longDescription: Unique identification assigned to a motor vehicle by the manufacturer that is not transferable or reusable

VV.longDescription: Proof or a receipt for the value of a service that has been performed or an expenditure that has been made

VWD.longDescription: Number assigned to a organization by the National Association of Boards of Pharmacy that have joined the Verified Accredited Wholesale Distributors program

VY.longDescription: Used in conjunction with the Master Link Number, primarily by logistic firms, to indicate where the document exists within that sequence [first set of digits] and the count of documents [second set of digits].
examples: 001002 indicates that this document is the first of two documents to be fulfilled at the same time

WBN.longDescription: The smallest available unit of space in a storage facility

WH.longDescription: Used primarily by logistic firms to associate order documents to warehouse shipments when documents are received independently or not simultaneously but need to be fulfilled at the same time

WLT.longDescription: Number identifying the section within an area of a storage facility. This further describes the position within the warehouse storage location number

WS.longDescription: Number to identify a specific area within a storage facility

WU.longDescription: The name or hull number assigned to a particular ship or vessel

XF.description: Government Bill Of Lading Office Code
XF.longDescription: Also known as a GBLOC and is typically 4 alpha numeric characters. Used by DOD transportation or cargo shipments

ReferenceID.description: Value as defined by the ReferenceQual

Description.description: Free-form textual description to clarify the related data elements and their content
examples: New products only. Do not reuse packaging

Time.description: All standard XML formats are accepted.

ReferenceQual.description: Code specifying the type of data in the ReferenceID/ReferenceDescription

PKY.longDescription: A unique identifier provided to licensed users of a software program

PL.longDescription: Version of a price list/catalog from which the related item's price was obtained

PPGP.longDescription: Used to indicate when items of an order or shipment should be grouped together for packing when there is no Master SKU. Generally a simple number or letter combination that is non-distinct

PRSH.longDescription: Unique identifier of the price sheet that the item is listed on

Q1.longDescription: Identifying number associated with receiving an estimate on services or merchandise

Q1B.longDescription: Value to identify a revised quote number

RL.longDescription: The secondary or backup location on a factory or plant's assembly floor where the product should be delivered

ROL.longDescription: A number indicating what specific roll the flooring originated from

RSN.longDescription: A non-binding reservation number for product not yet purchased

RU.longDescription: Identifying number assigned by a carrier or logistics department to a pre-planned route or to a required series of transportation links

SCHN.longDescription: Used to indicate the sales channel from which the order originated

SDR.longDescription: Used to communicate or return the partners revision number when the normalized field is used or not available

SDV.longDescription: Used to communicate or return the partners version number when the normalized field is used or not available

SE.longDescription: Number that uniquely identifies a specific item

SI.longDescription: Identification number assigned to the shipment by the shipper that uniquely identifies the shipment from origin to ultimate destination and is not subject to modification

SL.longDescription: Code indicating a geographical region used to identify sales

SLI.longDescription: An unique number for the line item[s] which is generated from the seller's system

SRE.longDescription: The last serial number value of a series of serial numbers

SRS.longDescription: The first serial number value of a series of serial numbers

TAN.longDescription: Used to communicate the membership number of a organization in a industry specific 3rd party group [i.e. National Costume Association Number]

TJ.longDescription: Also called a TIN, this qualifier is used to communicate the taxpayer's identification where required by law

TPF.longDescription: Number used or provided by a partner who is not involved in this transaction set for shipping charges

TPP.longDescription: Method of payment used by a partner who is not involved in this transaction set. Typically used to communicate end consumer information for packing slips

USED.longDescription: Used to communicate an Export Control Classification Number [ECCN] issued by the US Bureau of Industry and Security

V3.longDescription: A unique number assigned by a shipper or ship owner that links a ship or vessel to a trade route and is normally not reused

VT.longDescription: Unique identification assigned to a motor vehicle by the manufacturer that is not transferable or reusable

VV.longDescription: Proof or a receipt for the value of a service that has been performed or an expenditure that has been made

VWD.longDescription: Number assigned to a organization by the National Association of Boards of Pharmacy that have joined the Verified Accredited Wholesale Distributors program

VY.longDescription: Used in conjunction with the Master Link Number, primarily by logistic firms, to indicate where the document exists within that sequence [first set of digits] and the count of documents [second set of digits].
examples: 001002 indicates that this document is the first of two documents to be fulfilled at the same time

WBN.longDescription: The smallest available unit of space in a storage facility

WH.longDescription: Used primarily by logistic firms to associate order documents to warehouse shipments when documents are received independently or not simultaneously but need to be fulfilled at the same time

WLT.longDescription: Number identifying the section within an area of a storage facility. This further describes the position within the warehouse storage location number

WS.longDescription: Number to identify a specific area within a storage facility

WU.longDescription: The name or hull number assigned to a particular ship or vessel

XF.description: Government Bill Of Lading Office Code
XF.longDescription: Also known as a GBLOC and is typically 4 alpha numeric characters. Used by DOD transportation or cargo shipments

ReferenceID.description: Value as defined by the ReferenceQual

ContactTypeCode.description: Code identifying a type of contact

HM.longDescription: Who to contact regarding inquiries or emergencies for a hazardous load

MRP.longDescription: Person or persons responsible for monitoring material availability [MRP]

SC.longDescription: Point of contact for shipping information

TIC.longDescription: Point of contact for technical information

items.description: This group should be used if the associated normalized fields already contain information.

AU.longDescription: The Defense Switched Network (DSN) is the primary system of interbase communication for the U.S. Department of Defense

EX.longDescription: An additional telephone set that is connected to the same telephone line

FT.longDescription: A long-distance telephone network serving the civilian agencies of the United States federal government

ContactID.description: The value of the identified contact

ContactReference.description: Additional field to clarify a contact

DateTimeQualifier.description: Code specifying the type of date

036.longDescription: Date when something is no longer available/valid

076.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested delivery

077.description: Requested For Delivery Week of Date

087.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested shipment

100.longDescription: The date at which there is no shipment arrival timeline

110.longDescription: The date associated with the initial scheduled ship date

145.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is first available for business

146.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is no longer available for business

209.longDescription: A date on which the funds are at the disposal of the beneficiary or cease to be at the disposal of the ordering customer

371.longDescription: The expected date of receiving a good or service

405.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is created or manufactured

511.longDescription: Date when a product can not be legally sold due to it being unfit for use or consumption

636.longDescription: The most recent date at which an update was made to the transaction

ACT.longDescription: The date at which the document is effective for terms and contractual agreements

BBD.longDescription: Date when a product's optimal use or consumption has lapsed but is still legal for sale

CAD.longDescription: Date the item was added to the trading partner's internal catalog

CSD.longDescription: Date that the contract was signed. May be different from the date the contract comes into effect.

DLO.longDescription: The date and time related to loading cargo

MRB.longDescription: Indicates that the return document must be sent by the provided date or time

OTD.longDescription: The date when ownership of the goods change

POS.longDescription: Used to indicate the date/time that equipment was/must be in position (typically used to communicate when an empty trailer or container must be in position for loading a shipment)

TPD.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is taxed, typically seen with VAT

Time.description: All standard XML formats are accepted.

DateTimePeriod.description: A date, time, or range of dates and times

items.description: Transportation instructions specifying at what point costs, risks, obligations, and ownership shift from seller to buyer

FOBPayCode.description: Code identifying payment terms for transportation charges

CF.description: Collect - Freight Credited Back To Customer

RC.description: Return Container Freight Paid by Customer

RS.description: Return Container Freight Paid by Supplier

FOBLocationQualifier.description: Code identifying the party or location responsible for organizing and paying for transportation

RG.longDescription: Qualifies a code that identifies a geographic area where transportation rates apply

FOBLocationDescription.description: Free-form textual description of the location at which ownership of goods is transferred

FOBTitlePassageCode.description: Code describing the location of ownership of the goods changes

RG.longDescription: Qualifies a code that identifies a geographic area where transportation rates apply

FOBTitlePassageLocation.description: Location of ownership of the goods

TransportationTermsType.description: Code identifying the source of the transportation terms

01.longDescription: Used when the transportation terms are from the Incoterms standard

02.longDescription: Used when the transportation terms are some other standard the trading partner uses

03.longDescription: Used when there is no standard present for the transportation terms between the trading partner and customer

TransportationTerms.description: Code that defines to the recipient what types of fees are associated with the movement of goods. By default, if you do not send the TransportationTermsType, you are using the standard codes from the Incoterms website [http://www.iccwbo.org/products-and-services/trade-facilitation/]

RiskOfLossCode.description: Code specifying which party should bear the burden for risk of damage occurring to goods after the sale but before delivery

BY.description: Risk of Loss in Transit to Destination is Buyer's

FE.description: Risk of Loss in Transit to Freight Equalization Point is Seller's

PP.description: Risk of Loss in Transit to Pool Point is Seller's

SE.description: Risk of Loss in Transit to Destination is Seller's

Description.description: Free-form textual description to clarify the related data elements and their content
examples: New products only. Do not reuse packaging

items.description: Specifies carrier identity, transportation information, and equipment details

StatusCode.description: Code indicating the status of an order or shipment or the disposition of any difference between the quantity ordered and the quantity shipped for a line item or transaction

BK.longDescription: Product that was unavailable at the time of its original request

CarrierTransMethodCode.description: Code specifying the method or type of transportation for the shipment

CarrierAlphaCode.description: Standard Carrier Alpha Code[SCAC] - 2 to 4 digit alphabetic code assigned by the National Motor Freight Traffic Association identifying transportation companies

CarrierRouting.description: Free-form description of the routing/requested routing for shipment or the originating carrier's identity

EquipmentDescriptionCode.description: Code identifying type of equipment used for shipment

LU.longDescription: Indicates an unloading or loading device

UL.longDescription: A pallet or container used to load luggage, freight, and mail, on wide-body aircraft and specific narrow-body aircraft

CarrierEquipmentInitial.description: Prefix or alphabetic part of an equipment unit's identifying number

CarrierEquipmentNumber.description: Sequencing or serial part of an equipment unit's identifying number[Pure numeric form for equipment number is preferred]

EquipmentType.description: Free form description used to identify or describe the size and type of equipment used in shipping

OwnershipCode.description: Code indicating ownership of equipment used in transportation

PO.longDescription: Consolidated ownership of transporation units by multiple entities

RoutingSequenceCode.description: Code used to identify a stage of transport

JD.longDescription: Destination carrier receiving revenues resulting from junction contract

JO.longDescription: Origin carrier receiving revenues resulting from junction contract

X.description: Last Carrier in Route on Route Return Move

TransitDirectionCode.description: The point of origin and point of direction

TransitTimeQual.description: Code qualifying the amount of time associated with a transportation stage

HO.longDescription: Should only be used if less than 24 hours

TransitTime.description: Amount of time associated with a transportation stage

ServiceLevelCode.description: Code indicating the level of transportation service or the billing service offered by the transportation carrier

LM.longDescription: Delivery service offered by some couriers where courier delivers to local post office, who performs the final delivery

PA.description: Primary Service Area - Next Day by 10:30 A.M.

PC.description: Primary Service Area - Next Day by 9:30 A.M.

PN.description: Primary Service Area - Next Day by Noon

PR.description: Primary Service Area - Next Day by 5:00 P.M.

PS.description: Primary Service Area - Second Day by Noon

items.description: Represent an entity such as an organizational, physical location, property, or individual

AddressTypeCode.description: Code identifying an organizational entity, a physical location, property, or an individual

BOWN.longDescription: Party who owns the brand of the item[s]

BY.longDescription: Party who is purchasing the product and/or service, but is not necessarily initiating the order

CQ.longDescription: Used to indicate the location of the business's headquarters

DS.longDescription: Party who purchases goods, promotes and resales those goods to retailers at a markup or fee

ESIID.longDescription: 17 or 22-digit number used to identify a unique point of electric service delivery to a home or business

FR.longDescription: Used primary on reporting documents where there is no buyer or seller

FW.longDescription: Also called Freight Forwarder, or Forwarding Agent

N1.longDescription: Party which must be made aware of a shipment arriving at a location. Typically used with imports/exports

OB.longDescription: Party who initiates an order for goods and/or services, but is not necessarily purchasing it

PATI.longDescription: A location of a person receiving or registered to receive medical treatment

PLCO.longDescription: A location where goods enter the marketplace of the importing country

POAR.longDescription: A location where goods enter a country but may not require passing through customs

PODI.longDescription: A location where goods are unloaded

POEN.longDescription: A border crossing where persons and/or goods legally [via customs] enter a country

PW.longDescription: Location in which the shipment will be picked up from

RAMP.longDescription: A location where repair and maintenance is administered

TO.longDescription: Used primary on reporting documents where there is no buyer or seller

TS.longDescription: Transfer point between different carriers or between different vehicles of the same carrier

LocationCodeQualifier.description: Code identifying the structure or format of the related location number[s]

10.description: Department of Defense Activity Address Code
10.longDescription: A six position code that uniquely identifies a Department of Defense unit, activity or organization (DoDDAC)

33.longDescription: A five character identification assigned by the Department of Defense's Defense Logistics Agency used as a standardized method of identifying a given legal entity at a specific location (CAGE)

BE.longDescription: The standard address location code for a specific equipment location as used in the telephone industry

D.longDescription: Classification of U.S. Customs districts and ports for which shipments are reportable

K.longDescription: Classification of foreign ports by geographic trade area and country from the Maritime Administration

TPL.longDescription: Location number assigned by a third party who was not involved in the buying cycle and is different than the buying and selling location numbers

AddressLocationNumber.description: Unique value assigned to identify a location

AddressName.description: Primary free-form textual description of a location

AddressAlternateName.description: Additional free-form description of a location

AddressAlternateName2.description: Additional free-form description of a location

State.description: Code[Standard State/Province] as defined by appropriate government agency

PostalCode.description: International postal zone excluding punctuation and blanks[Zip Code for United States]

Country.description: Human readable description identifying the country

LocationID.description: Provides further description to the address information. This can be either text or an ID

CountrySubDivision.description: An administrative division such as a subnational entity, constituent unit, or country subdivision

AddressTaxIdNumber.description: Unique number assigned by the relevant tax authority to identify a party for use in relation to Value Added Tax[VAT]

AddressTaxExemptNumber.description: Unique tax exemption number assigned by the relevant tax authority to identify an entity or organization

DateTimeQualifier.description: Code specifying the type of date

036.longDescription: Date when something is no longer available/valid

076.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested delivery

077.description: Requested For Delivery Week of Date

087.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested shipment

100.longDescription: The date at which there is no shipment arrival timeline

110.longDescription: The date associated with the initial scheduled ship date

145.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is first available for business

146.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is no longer available for business

209.longDescription: A date on which the funds are at the disposal of the beneficiary or cease to be at the disposal of the ordering customer

371.longDescription: The expected date of receiving a good or service

405.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is created or manufactured

511.longDescription: Date when a product can not be legally sold due to it being unfit for use or consumption

636.longDescription: The most recent date at which an update was made to the transaction

ACT.longDescription: The date at which the document is effective for terms and contractual agreements

BBD.longDescription: Date when a product's optimal use or consumption has lapsed but is still legal for sale

CAD.longDescription: Date the item was added to the trading partner's internal catalog

CSD.longDescription: Date that the contract was signed. May be different from the date the contract comes into effect.

DLO.longDescription: The date and time related to loading cargo

MRB.longDescription: Indicates that the return document must be sent by the provided date or time

OTD.longDescription: The date when ownership of the goods change

POS.longDescription: Used to indicate the date/time that equipment was/must be in position (typically used to communicate when an empty trailer or container must be in position for loading a shipment)

TPD.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is taxed, typically seen with VAT

Time.description: All standard XML formats are accepted.

DateTimePeriod.description: A date, time, or range of dates and times

items.description: Describes the seal used in transportation

SealStatusCode.description: Code indicating condition of door seal upon arrival

SealNumber.description: Stamped lock that is on the container

ReferenceQual.description: Code specifying the type of data in the ReferenceID/ReferenceDescription

02.description: Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication
02.longDescription: A unique identification code for a particular bank

12.longDescription: Account number in a trading partner's accounts receivable system

19.longDescription: Different entities belonging to the same parent company

5D.longDescription: Identifies and describes the type of credit line in use

AI.longDescription: Any invoice numbers in relation to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AN.longDescription: Any PO numbers in relation to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AO.longDescription: Number assigned by the buying or logistics organization approving the delivery, routing, or pickup of the shipment. This is not the tracking number

AOAC.longDescription: Any order acknowledgement number related to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AOCH.longDescription: Any order change number related to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

ARE.longDescription: Any release number in relation to the transaction, but not the primary identifier

AUED.longDescription: Used to communicate an Export Declaration Number [EDN] issued by the Australian Customs Service

AWB.longDescription: Non-negotiable transport document issued by an airline for information relating to ownership, contract of carriage, and receipt of goods

AY.longDescription: Authorization number supplied by a finance company prior to shipment of product

BAF.longDescription: The reference value that is provided to the sender/shipper that indicates a parcel has been handled off to the carrier

BL.longDescription: A document that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage and is a receipt of goods that has been issued or approved by a government official

BM.longDescription: A shipper assigned number that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage and is a receipt of goods

BT.longDescription: Identification number assigned to a specific group of products from the same production cycle for tracking or accountability purposes

CAN.longDescription: Used when individual accounts have been consolidated

CN.longDescription: Reference number assigned by the carrier

CRM.longDescription: Reference number that relates a credit memo to an invoice

CT.longDescription: Reference number of an agreement concluded between parties.

CUDN.longDescription: ID assigned to a shipment or package by the government when customs paperwork has been completed

D3.description: National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy Number
D3.longDescription: Identifier assigned by the National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy (NCPDP)

D5.longDescription: A number given during the dyeing process to identify what vat the material was colored in

DIP.longDescription: Number identifying a debtor-in-possession (DIP) [a debtor-in-possession is a person or corporation who has filed for bankruptcy protection but still holds property that a creditor has a right to]

DJ.longDescription: The reference value that correlates to the proof of delivery of a parcel

DK.longDescription: Number that indicates what loading or receiving bay should use at the trading partner's facility

DNN.longDescription: The number relating to a document that proves a shipment was successfully received. Often times this document requires a signature, and if so, the accompanying date will be when the note was signed.

DRRN.longDescription: Value that indicates the version of a design, primarily used in communications to a manufacture to ensure that the correct part or item is created

DRWN.longDescription: Identifies a technical design or drawing. This number is retained across all versions of a design. Any revisions are communicated with a separate revision number (see DRRN qualifier)

EF.longDescription: Number assigned by a bank to reference or trace a payment

ENGC.longDescription: Value indicating a change has been made in the specification of a part

ENGN.longDescription: Identification number marked on the engine block [i.e. Car, Motorcycle]

ES.longDescription: Identification number used by U.S. exporters to electronically declare their international exports

EWC.longDescription: Code used to identify waste as listed in the European Waste Catalogue

FL.longDescription: Number issued by a federal government agency, assigned to a provider of service that practices business under the agency's purview

FR.longDescription: A bill rendered by a carrier for freight charges applicable to a shipment

FW.description: State or Provincial License Identification Number
FW.longDescription: Number issued by a government agency, assigned to a provider of service that practices business under the agency's purview

GC.longDescription: Reference number of an agreement concluded between a company and a government agency

GP.longDescription: Priority rating number assigned to a contract as defined by the Department of Commerce

GRN.longDescription: Unique account number assigned by a retailer to a person or persons [gift, bridal, baby, etc]. Typically seen with dropship.

GT.description: Goods and Service Tax Registration Number

HC.longDescription: A unique code stamped on metal that relays the manufacturing and origin information

IMEI.longDescription: Unique identification number used for mobile phones

INV.longDescription: Unique identifier assigned by the billing party

KAN.longDescription: Identification number associated with the related Kanban card

LF.longDescription: The location on a factory or plant's assembly floor where the product should be delivered

LO.longDescription: Number that represents the loading, unloading, capacity and overall total volume of a shipment. Typically seen in Logistics

LT.longDescription: Identification number that is a specific portion of a production run in order to track specific equipment or material used during the process. Multiple lots can make up a batch

MB.longDescription: Value that groups multiple BOLs together [most common when one order has multiple ship to's]

MC.longDescription: Number used to identify what roll or frame of microfilm should be used or looked at

MS.description: Manufacturers Material Safety Data Sheet Number
MS.longDescription: Reference number of an official document outlining what a specific product is made up of. This is mainly used for safety in regards to hazardous chemicals, but extends to storage, handling, etc. This is maintained by an organization which is independent to each country

OA.longDescription: Number assigned by the buying or logistics organization approving the delivery, routing, or pickup of ocean freight. This is not the tracking number or lading number.

OB.longDescription: A document that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage, and acts as a receipt of goods for overseas shipments

OC.longDescription: An identifying number of a container which is transported via ship. Typically used for imports

OD.longDescription: A unique code for returns to identify the order details [RA/RMA]

P4.longDescription: Used to indicate the associated project number

PAN.longDescription: Used when a change to an account number has been made and the previous number needs to be reported
