MS.longDescription: Reference number of an official document outlining what a specific product is made up of. This is mainly used for safety in regards to hazardous chemicals, but extends to storage, handling, etc. This is maintained by an organization which is independent to each country

OA.longDescription: Number assigned by the buying or logistics organization approving the delivery, routing, or pickup of ocean freight. This is not the tracking number or lading number.

OB.longDescription: A document that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage, and acts as a receipt of goods for overseas shipments

OC.longDescription: An identifying number of a container which is transported via ship. Typically used for imports

OD.longDescription: A unique code for returns to identify the order details [RA/RMA]

P4.longDescription: Used to indicate the associated project number

PAN.longDescription: Used when a change to an account number has been made and the previous number needs to be reported

PD.longDescription: Number uniquely identifying an agreement for a special offer or price

PK.longDescription: Number that identifies the packing list or slip. Not intended to be used as a indicator that a packing list is required, or a summary of the content on the list

PKY.longDescription: A unique identifier provided to licensed users of a software program

PL.longDescription: Version of a price list/catalog from which the related item's price was obtained

PPGP.longDescription: Used to indicate when items of an order or shipment should be grouped together for packing when there is no Master SKU. Generally a simple number or letter combination that is non-distinct

PRSH.longDescription: Unique identifier of the price sheet that the item is listed on

Q1.longDescription: Identifying number associated with receiving an estimate on services or merchandise

Q1B.longDescription: Value to identify a revised quote number

RL.longDescription: The secondary or backup location on a factory or plant's assembly floor where the product should be delivered

ROL.longDescription: A number indicating what specific roll the flooring originated from

RSN.longDescription: A non-binding reservation number for product not yet purchased

RU.longDescription: Identifying number assigned by a carrier or logistics department to a pre-planned route or to a required series of transportation links

SCHN.longDescription: Used to indicate the sales channel from which the order originated

SDR.longDescription: Used to communicate or return the partners revision number when the normalized field is used or not available

SDV.longDescription: Used to communicate or return the partners version number when the normalized field is used or not available

SE.longDescription: Number that uniquely identifies a specific item

SI.longDescription: Identification number assigned to the shipment by the shipper that uniquely identifies the shipment from origin to ultimate destination and is not subject to modification

SL.longDescription: Code indicating a geographical region used to identify sales

SLI.longDescription: An unique number for the line item[s] which is generated from the seller's system

SRE.longDescription: The last serial number value of a series of serial numbers

SRS.longDescription: The first serial number value of a series of serial numbers

TAN.longDescription: Used to communicate the membership number of a organization in a industry specific 3rd party group [i.e. National Costume Association Number]

TJ.longDescription: Also called a TIN, this qualifier is used to communicate the taxpayer's identification where required by law

TPF.longDescription: Number used or provided by a partner who is not involved in this transaction set for shipping charges

TPP.longDescription: Method of payment used by a partner who is not involved in this transaction set. Typically used to communicate end consumer information for packing slips

USED.longDescription: Used to communicate an Export Control Classification Number [ECCN] issued by the US Bureau of Industry and Security

V3.longDescription: A unique number assigned by a shipper or ship owner that links a ship or vessel to a trade route and is normally not reused

VT.longDescription: Unique identification assigned to a motor vehicle by the manufacturer that is not transferable or reusable

VV.longDescription: Proof or a receipt for the value of a service that has been performed or an expenditure that has been made

VWD.longDescription: Number assigned to a organization by the National Association of Boards of Pharmacy that have joined the Verified Accredited Wholesale Distributors program

VY.longDescription: Used in conjunction with the Master Link Number, primarily by logistic firms, to indicate where the document exists within that sequence [first set of digits] and the count of documents [second set of digits].
examples: 001002 indicates that this document is the first of two documents to be fulfilled at the same time

WBN.longDescription: The smallest available unit of space in a storage facility

WH.longDescription: Used primarily by logistic firms to associate order documents to warehouse shipments when documents are received independently or not simultaneously but need to be fulfilled at the same time

WLT.longDescription: Number identifying the section within an area of a storage facility. This further describes the position within the warehouse storage location number

WS.longDescription: Number to identify a specific area within a storage facility

WU.longDescription: The name or hull number assigned to a particular ship or vessel

XF.description: Government Bill Of Lading Office Code
XF.longDescription: Also known as a GBLOC and is typically 4 alpha numeric characters. Used by DOD transportation or cargo shipments

ReferenceID.description: Value as defined by the ReferenceQual

NoteCode.description: Code specifying the type of note

CCG.longDescription: i.e Need a specific part for a specific year vehicle

GFT.longDescription: i.e. Indicates no pricing on packing slip and a message to the receiver

MKG.longDescription: i.e. If you bought this product, you might like this other product

PCK.longDescription: Hard-coded notes to be placed on the packing slip

PRN.longDescription: i.e. Your name on this blanket

RTN.longDescription: i.e. If you need to return this product

SPE.longDescription: i.e. This needs to be packaged a specific way

TPA.longDescription: Textual information regarding how to refer to, or comply with, the agreement of the trading partner

Note.description: Free-form textual description of the note

LanguageCode.description: Code designating the language used in text. ISO 639 language code

CommodityCodeQualifier.description: Code identifying the commodity coding system used for Commodity Code

A.description: Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States Annotated

F.longDescription: A four digit subset of the Federal Stock Number used to group standardization documents and their products into logical families

I.description: Milstamp AITC or Water Commodity Code

NFT.longDescription: Code used to inidate the tariff rate applicable to the item, as defined by NAFTA

CommodityCode.description: Code describing a commodity or group of commodities

TaxTypeCode.description: Identification of the type of duty, tax, or fee applicable to commodities or of tax applicable to services

A.longDescription: A rate where there is a single price for a number of separate supplies of goods or services, but one or all of them are at a different VAT rate

AF.longDescription: Taxes associated with the production or sale of an alcoholic item

AVT.longDescription: Total of all VAT taxes when no further clarification is required

AX.longDescription: Taxes associated with the production or sale of a tobacco laced item

BB.longDescription: Taxed amount, similar to sales tax, for goods purchased outside your taxing authorities jurisdiction paid to your tax authority

BE.longDescription: Combinations of Goods and Services tax and Provincial/State Sales tax

CA.longDescription: City Tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

CE.longDescription: County taxes paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

CP.longDescription: County/Parish tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

CS.longDescription: City tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

EV.longDescription: Taxes on environmental pollutants or on goods whose use produces pollutants

FD.longDescription: Federal Tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

FT.longDescription: Federal taxes paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

GR.longDescription: Tax on the total gross revenues of a company. Similar to a sales tax but levied on the seller of goods

GS.longDescription: Tax on goods purchased and/or services rendered

H215.longDescription: Duty paid in terms of specific amount per unit as defined in a tariff

H535.longDescription: Duties paid on goods in a tariff category that are subjected to a different amount or percent than the other goods in that category

H625.longDescription: Taxes associated with the production or sale of a non-alcoholic item

H640.longDescription: Taxes calculated by destination location, paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

H650.longDescription: Taxes calculated by originating location, paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

H670.longDescription: Taxes paid by the producer or seller of vehicle tires, generally included in list price

H720.longDescription: Money paid to the government for a control or regulated substance

H760.longDescription: State Taxes on materials that are deemed dangerous or harmful that will be used for producing goods

H780.longDescription: Taxes paid by the producer or seller of specific products where any tax revenue generated is designated to fund the cleanup of Superfund sites

HZ.longDescription: Taxes for the disposal of materials that are deemed dangerous or harmful

I431.description: U.S. Customs Service [USCS] Flat Assist Amount
I431.longDescription: Flat amount associated with any import items provided in the use of production or sale of merchandise

LO.longDescription: Local Tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

LS.longDescription: State and Local tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

LT.longDescription: Local tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

QST.longDescription: The tax paid to government of Quebec for the sale of goods and services

S.longDescription: If you are registered for VAT, this is the default rate used

SBSD.longDescription: Amount granted by the government to assist in competitive pricing

SE.longDescription: State taxes paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

SL.longDescription: State and Local tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

SP.longDescription: State/Provincial tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

SQ.longDescription: Combination of State/Provincial Sales and Quebec Sales [see ST and QST for definitions]

ST.longDescription: State/Provincial tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

SU.longDescription: Combination of Sales and Use Tax [see SATA and BB for definitions]

SUIP.longDescription: Text description used to provide context for usage

TX.longDescription: Total of all taxes when no further clarification is required

UNDF.longDescription: No additional information provided by Trading Partner

VA.longDescription: Consumption tax where the ultimate tax burden is paid by the end consumer with the benefit of additional accounting mechanisms due to the tax being paid at each transaction stage

Z.longDescription: A rate that is taxable for VAT, but the VAT rate is zero per cent. You can generally reclaim VAT on purchases that are sold as zero-rated goods or services. Zero rates are different than an exemption from VAT

TaxPercentQual.description: Code indicating on what basis a tax percent is calculated

7.description: Base Price Amount Less Previous Discount

TaxPercent.description: The percentage that is applied to determine the tax amount. Percentages should be represented as real numbers[0% through 100% should be normalized to 0.0 through 100.00]

JurisdictionQual.description: Code identifying the source of the data used in the Tax JurisdictionCode

JurisdictionCode.description: Code represents the City, State, or Providence[tax authority] associated with the Tax group

TaxExemptCode.description: Code indicating whether the header or item level data is exempt[or not exempt] for the tax and taxing authority indicated in JurisdictionCode

0.longDescription: Goods exempted from taxes because they are designated for export

RelationshipCode.description: Code identifying whether the tax amount is included in the total transaction amount

PercentDollarBasis.description: Monetary amount that is used when calculating a tax, allowance, or charge amount.

TaxHandlingCode.description: Code indicating method of handling for a tax

05.description: Charge to be paid by vendor

06.description: Charge to be paid by customer[Buying Organization]

TaxID.description: Number assigned to a purchaser[buyer, orderer] by a tax jurisdiction[state, country, etc]

Description.description: Free-form textual description to clarify the related data elements and their content
examples: New products only. Do not reuse packaging

items.description: Details a charge, allowance, or service associated with the transaction

AllowChrgIndicator.description: Code which indicates an allowance or charge for the service specified

AllowChrgCode.description: Code describing the type of allowance or charge for the service specified

A010.longDescription: Minimum amount charge for processing a transaction. Generally used for smaller transactions, such as drop-ship

A060.longDescription: Fee associated with the sale of batteries that contain lead and sulfuric acid assessed by many state governments

A130.longDescription: Charge or discount for additional material required

A170.longDescription: Differences from rounding an amount when the unit of measure is not eaches

A260.longDescription: Costs related to advertising goods and company brands

A320.longDescription: Fees and costs associated with transportation of merchandise via an air carrier

A400.longDescription: Allowance given based on purchases being made during a specific time period where no performance such as price reduction or advertisement, etc. is required. This is usually a per unit/case amount.

A470.longDescription: Costs and fees associated with developing graphics or designs to be used in the presentation, packaging, or marketing of a product or item

A480.longDescription: Costs or fees associated with combining components of a product or item before being sold to the end consumer

A485.longDescription: Assists are properties [either intellectual or physical] that are provided by a company to a foreign partner with the intended purpose of improving the native company's product when it will be sold in the native company's country

A650.longDescription: Costs or fees associated with moving a tractor [truck] without a trailer

A720.longDescription: Cost associated with shipping in partial cases

A721.longDescription: Fees associated with the use of a person or firm in negotiating agreements or bargains between two or more entities, including customs

A950.longDescription: Charge associated with not contacting the carrier to schedule a drop off date and time

ASSL.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with altering the product line

B000.longDescription: Any electronic payment that goes through a third-party [i.e. ACH payments]

B020.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with meeting required specifications without 3rd party certification

B050.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with confirmation from 3rd party agency of meeting required specifications

B090.longDescription: Fees not related to the current order cycle but are instead either prepayments or unpaid from a previous cycle

B130.longDescription: Allowance or charge related to applying required state-specific stamping to the cigarette pack and/or carton.

B190.longDescription: Cost associated with ensuring a truck or package remains intact to destination [i.e. using a Seal on a truck door]

B270.longDescription: Cost of the service/goods is paid by the receiver

B280.longDescription: Combined allowance given based on purchases made and performance requirements such as advertising or displays during a specific time period. This is usually a per unit/case amount.

B310.longDescription: Amount or percentage of the commission for a sale

B320.longDescription: To reduce the price of a product so that it is more align with other similar products in the market

B560.longDescription: Used for the purchase of a storage or shipping container [non returnable/non refundable]

B570.longDescription: Used for the rental of a storage or shipping container [returnable/refundable]

B660.longDescription: Cost and fees with specific terms relating to a contract

B720.longDescription: Fees associated with the cost of advertising a specific product available at a specific retailer

B750.longDescription: Battery deposit to promote recycling. Similar to a container deposit, however is generally only seen on automotive transactions

B770.longDescription: Cost associated for marking items for inventory reductions and close-outs

B785.longDescription: Reimbursement paid to a retailer to offset the reduced cost of product when a coupon is presented by the end-consumer

B800.longDescription: Reductions in cost due to money given or provided previously

B820.longDescription: Charge or discount related to currency exchange rates

B840.longDescription: Charge or allowance tied to a specific customer account on a given order or invoice when something is being shipped directly to another business

B870.longDescription: Total fees or costs for managing customs/duties of goods not paid to government agencies

B940.longDescription: Adjusting the size or shape of merchandises, generally seen in Lumber and fabric orders

B950.longDescription: During transportation or storage, merchandise lost value in part or whole

BRDP.longDescription: Fees and charges other than import and export duties and taxes that may be incurred while transporting freight across national borders. May be assessed by the country of import or export, or by the carrier.

C000.longDescription: Merchandise arrived in a state that indicated the item was manufactured incorrectly or not to specifications

C030.longDescription: Generic costs relating to the transportation over and beyond the expected amount defined by contract or agreement

C040.longDescription: Costs or fees associated with transporting goods or merchandise when the size or method is unknown

C080.longDescription: Charges or compensation for loading or unloading delays for containers that are not yet under the possession of the consignee

C110.longDescription: Used for containers that carry a refundable cost. Consumer bottle or can deposits are typically seen here

C190.longDescription: Charges or compensation for laden or empty containers when under the possession of the consignee that are potentially blocking container availability or movement

C220.longDescription: Charge or allowance tied to product development.  Often used for joint development of a product between two entities.

C260.longDescription: Discount offered related to an agreed-upon incentive

C300.longDescription: Deduction above and beyond normal discounts

C310.longDescription: Non-specific deduction off of a price

C320.longDescription: Cost relating to how merchandise is located within a retail or online store. Typically seen as end-cap stands

C350.longDescription: Discount provide to or by a distributor to promote the adoption of a product. Typically seen in beverage and grocery orders

C420.longDescription: Charge or discount related to the transportation of goods over short distances as a part of a larger intermodal move [i.e. from cargo ship to warehouse]

C460.longDescription: Allowance given if the product can be shipped directly from a producing/manufacturing plant, bypassing the supplier's DC. This usually requires the order to meet certain criteria such as limited items and full pallets.

C490.longDescription: Used for drums that carry a rental fee or a refundable cost. Similar to container deposit

C510.longDescription: Fees associated with the use or supply of ice additional fees may be associated with using dry ice

C530.longDescription: Total fees and costs associated with a failure to successfully pass customs

C540.longDescription: Pre-ordering or purchasing goods before schedule

C550.longDescription: Costs or discount associated with an early payment to a creditor

C560.longDescription: Costs or discount associated with being able to ship or delivery merchandise ahead of defined timelines

C660.longDescription: Costs or fees associated with creating or changing an item or part of an item

C850.longDescription: Cost associated with increasing the importance of a transaction going through customs

C940.longDescription: Total fees or costs relating to exporting or importing of goods not paid to government agencies

CA00.longDescription: Costs or discounts associated with paying debts in government issued currency

CLN.longDescription: Cost and fees associated with cleaning

CLRY.longDescription: Allowances or charges associated with collection and recycling

COLC.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with the change or addition of color

CONS.longDescription: The discount or fee associated with the change of custody of goods while retaining ownership until said good is sold

COUR.longDescription: Fees relating to the use of a courier service

D080.longDescription: Costs associated with protecting a trading partner from a loss if a product's price drops in a particular time period

D170.longDescription: Used to indicate the quantity of goods shipped, but not invoiced

D230.longDescription: Costs relating to the transportation over and beyond the expected amount defined by contract or agreement, used for freight companies and logistic companies for large shipments

D240.longDescription: Fees and costs associated with the transportation of merchandise. Used by freight companies and logistic companies for large shipments

D250.longDescription: Costs associated with keeping products and merchandise from spoiling

D260.longDescription: Costs associated with purchasing fuel relating to transportation

D270.longDescription: Costs relating to the purchasing of vehicle fuel over and beyond the allotted amount defined by contract or agreement

D340.longDescription: Fees and costs relating to the manufacturing, transportation, distribution and sale of goods and services, however does not include taxes

D500.longDescription: Fees and costs associated with the marking, packing, and loading of merchandise for transportation

D530.longDescription: Costs relating to shipping or transporting material that is deemed hazardous

D540.longDescription: Costs relating to marking, packing and loading material that is deemed hazardous when the destination is within the same country as the origin point

D550.longDescription: Costs relating to marking, packing and loading material that is deemed hazardous when the destination is not within the same country as the origin point

D560.longDescription: Costs relating to the storage of material that is deemed hazardous

D800.longDescription: Costs associated with transportation on inland waterways

D870.longDescription: Cost relating to checking or testing product by either a government or private entity

D900.longDescription: Costs or fees associated with the setup or install of the product or item

D920.longDescription: Cost relating to making a claim against an insurance policy or the amount needed to cleared before a claim can be filed, similar to a deductible

D940.longDescription: Costs and fees relating to carrying insurance on goods and merchandise [on-going]

D980.longDescription: Costs and fees relating to the purchase of insurance on goods and merchandise [one time]

DAA.longDescription: Fee associated for shipping with deficit weight

E170.longDescription: Costs relating to labeling boxes or containers that have individual saleable items in them for transportation

E210.longDescription: Fees associated with the hiring of labor

E240.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with verifying and configuring the product to ensure it is within allowed specifications

E280.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with the payment after the agreed upon date

E350.longDescription: Fees associated with processing a letter of credit as payment for goods and or services

E380.longDescription: Costs relating to the use or need of a vehicle of this nature

E470.longDescription: Allowance based on purchases being made during a specific time period where no performance such as price reduction or advertisement, etc. is required. This is a lump sum amount and is not based on the quantity of the item ordered.

E620.longDescription: Charge or discount used to offset the fluctuating costs of raw materials

E720.longDescription: Fees or discounts relating to a newly open or built distribution center

E730.longDescription: Fees or discounts relating to a newly created or developed item

E740.longDescription: Fees or discounts relating to a newly open or built store

E770.longDescription: Fees or discounts relating to a newly open or built warehouse

E99.longDescription: Discount associated with an in-store coupon code using the EAN-99 barcode

EDIP.longDescription: The fee or discount associated with the EDI transaction

EXTM.longDescription: Fees associated with unexpected miles traveled

F110.longDescription: Costs or discounts associated with extra material or product due to an error in manufacturing [i.e. a 100 yard spool actually has 105 yards when it arrives]

F155.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with the containment, protection, and identification of merchandise

F170.longDescription: Used for pallets that carry a refundable cost

F180.longDescription: Used for the purchase of a pallet [non returnable/non refundable]

F190.longDescription: Costs associated with packaging merchandise on a pallet

F280.longDescription: Credits or fees associated with compliance in agreement with trading partner

F330.longDescription: Combination of loading, paperwork, and transportation of goods or merchandise when the size is unknown ahead of time

F340.longDescription: Fees associated with loading transportation vehicle and required paperwork

F460.longDescription: Cost for sending mail through a postal system, such as mailing a contract in an envelop via USPS

F580.longDescription: Fees and costs associated with the preparation and transportation of merchandise

F670.longDescription: Fees associated with running advertising or adjusting prices when dictated by only the seller or buyer, not both

F680.longDescription: Charge or discount related to price variance.  Used to correct a price sent on a related transaction by communicating the variance between the originally transmitted price and the correct price.

F730.longDescription: Cost associated with increasing the importance of the transaction

F760.longDescription: Fees associated with processing the transaction [i.e. paperwork]

F800.longDescription: Fees associated with the cost of advertising a brand or product for a limited period of time

F970.longDescription: Amount paid by way of reduction, return, or refund on what has already been paid or contributed

FRYC.longDescription: Charge for ferrying freight across a body of water. May be the primary mode of transportation, or part of a multi-modal shipment.

G170.longDescription: Cost associated with moving product or merchandise between locations to help with inventory management

G210.longDescription: Charge associated with the purchasing or renting of a cable reel/drum

G220.longDescription: Costs associated with the transportation or storage of goods where mechanical refrigeration or chemical refrigerant is used (For temperature protection not related to refrigeration, see H910)

G290.longDescription: Fees associated with ensuring compliance with government regulations

G330.longDescription: Charge or discount related to the rental of additional equipment.

G360.longDescription: Costs relating to having to re-package merchandise for transportation [i.e. having to open three single size boxes to make variety packs for individual stores]

G450.longDescription: Fees and cost associated with transportation of merchandise when the final destination is a residential address

G470.longDescription: Fees associated with stocking merchandise in a store. Typically seen with VMI [Vendor Managed Inventory]

G530.longDescription: Fees and costs relating to repairing or cleaning merchandise that arrives in a state that requires processing to make an item saleable at full price

G580.longDescription: Amount paid for the use of license material

G590.longDescription: Value of the components of an item, product or piece of equipment when broken apart into sub components and sold

G610.longDescription: Charge or discount for delivering goods on a Saturday

G630.longDescription: Charge or discount for picking up goods on a Saturday

G660.longDescription: Value loss of components that are non-salvageable

G680.longDescription: When items on a shipment are sorted and/or separated according to differentiating characteristics

G821.longDescription: Fees and costs associated with the transportation of merchandise. Used for small package carriers and drop ship

G830.longDescription: Fees and costs associated with the preparation and transportation of merchandise [combines both shipping and handling]. Used for small package carriers and drop ship

G860.longDescription: Cost of the estimated loss of product or merchandise for various reasons, including theft and damages

G870.longDescription: Cost of material and labor relating to using a shrink wrap process

G890.longDescription: Costs or discounts relating to the use of only one invoice for multiple transactions, or as defined in agreements with trading partner

G910.longDescription: A single shipment is tendered from one shipper, at one location and time, for one consignee at one destination, covered by one bill of lading or shipping receipt. Typically not part of any pre-existing contract between consignee and shipper.

G960.longDescription: Cost associated with reserving space for a specific product on a retailer's shelves or within their supply chain. Typically used for newer products that do not have proven sellability

GWRP.longDescription: Material and labor costs for the final consumer product that is intended as a gift

H060.longDescription: Costs associated with the use of equipment [either special or routine] in either creation or delivery of goods

H070.longDescription: Costs associated with adding details to a product or good, such as powder coating

H090.longDescription: Any costs relating to steps taken in packaging or transit due to the goods requiring additional attention [i.e. fragile]

H110.longDescription: Cost taken to ensure merchandise arrives in optimal condition in regards to packaging [i.e. Packaging peanuts for fragile merchandise, Tectrol Gas for keeping berries fresh]

H230.longDescription: Charge or discount for dividing an order quantity into smaller delivery quantities, either to reduce order lead time or control inventory investment.

H270.longDescription: Charge or discount related to the usage of a spotted trailer (also called Drop and Hook).

H400.longDescription: Costs or fees assessed at each additional point at which the carrier has to stop and deliver goods

H420.longDescription: Storing merchandise in the means it was transported

H540.longDescription: Costs associated with items that are included with the purchase of another item, but not added onto the total price of the partnered item

H550.longDescription: Additional amount added to the usual cost

H560.longDescription: Cost of the estimated loss of perishable product or merchandise for spoilage reasons and damaged packaging or merchandise

H806.longDescription: Reductions in cost due to over payment of taxes given or provided previously

H910.longDescription: Charge or discount related non-weather related temperature protection needed for an item or shipment (For weather related protection, see I610)

I060.longDescription: Costs relating to labeling individual items for sale or transportation

I070.longDescription: Costs associated with reporting required for tobacco products

I100.longDescription: Costs relating to re-tooling of a specialized tool or part

I110.longDescription: Costs relating to the setup or creation of a specialized tool or part

I131.longDescription: Entire amount of allowance and charges

I160.longDescription: Costs associated with keeping goods or merchandise on a train track for the purpose of storage

I170.longDescription: Costs or discounts associated with selling an item or product to a third-party, who in turns sells it to a consumer

I310.longDescription: Fees or discounts for filling a transport vehicle to capacity

I410.longDescription: Costs relating to goods or merchandise that cannot or would not be resold for any reason

I530.longDescription: Fees or discounts relating to the amount of a product or item purchased [i.e. bulk discount or custom single item orders]

I570.longDescription: Costs, fees or discounts relating the use of, shipping from or to, and storage at a warehouse

I590.longDescription: Fees associated with a product or item's warranty or the actions taken as required by the warranty

I610.longDescription: Charge or discount related to additional weather protection needed for an item or shipment.

IDCT.longDescription: Failing to fill out paperwork correctly

IDL.longDescription: Fees relating to dropping off shipment indoors

LAY.longDescription: Cost and fees associated with delays occurring at the pick up or drop off point

LDG.longDescription: Cost and fees relating to loading cargo

LTL.longDescription: Charge or discount associated with shipping less than a full truckload

MTC.longDescription: Costs associated with the Mill Test Report

OVSZ.longDescription: Charge or discount associated with processing oversized goods or material [i.e. plywood sheets that are larger than the standard 4'x8' size]

PERN.longDescription: Fees for adding logos, monograms or other personalizations to a product

PSIS.longDescription: Charge or discount associated with shipment of merchandise sold in advance with unpaid merchandise

PWH.longDescription: Fees relating to the movement of cargo on or off the wharf or pier

RALM.longDescription: Charge or fee associated with the repair and replacement of a railway system

RCC.longDescription: Fees associated with adjustments made to the bill of lading while shipment is in transit

RUOR.longDescription: Fees associated with a shorten timeline for a transaction

SLEV.longDescription: The fee or discount associated applying a protective casing to an item

SLIP.longDescription: Charge or discount associated with the use of a slip sheet

SUIP.longDescription: Text description used to provide context for usage

TPRD.longDescription: Allowance or charge related to an item having a temporary price reduction, such as a cents off promotion.

UNDF.longDescription: No additional information provided by trading partner

UNL.longDescription: Cost and fees relating to unloading cargo

UNSZ.longDescription: Charge or discount associated with processing undersized goods or material [i.e. plywood sheets that are smaller than the standard 4'x8' size]

AllowChrgAgencyCode.description: Code identifying the agency assigning the code values

UNECE.description: United Nations - Economic Commission for Europe

AllowChrgAgency.description: Agency maintained code identifying the service, promotion, allowance, or charge

AllowChrgAmt.description: Amount of the allowance or charge

AllowChrgPercentQual.description: Code indicating on what basis an allowance or charge percent is calculated

7.description: Base Price Amount Less Previous Discount

AllowChrgPercent.description: Percentage of allowance or charge. Percentages should be represented as real numbers[0% through 100% should be normalized to 0.0 through 100.00]

PercentDollarBasis.description: Monetary amount that is used when calculating a tax, allowance, or charge amount.

AllowChrgRate.description: Value expressed in monetary currency that applies to the given quantity [i.e. The rate is $5.00 off one dozen]. [AllowChrgRate, AllowChrgQty, AllowChrgQtyUOM fields should all be sent in conjunction with each other]

AllowChrgQtyUOM.description: The unit of measure used in relation with AllowChrgQty[AllowChrgRate, AllowChrgQty, AllowChrgQtyUOM fields should all be sent in conjunction with each other]

AM.longDescription: A sealed glass capsule containing a liquid

DD.longDescription: Used to describe angles. This is not to be used to describe temperatures.

DE.longDescription: Equal to 1.375 cubic feet in the United States. Typically used to measure wood

DWT.longDescription: Used in the valuation and measurement of precious metals. Equal to 24 grains, 120 of a troy ounce, and 1.55517384 grams.

FZ.longDescription: Equal to 1/20 of an Imperial Pint, or 28.416 milliliters

JO.longDescription: Usually used for ordering pipe. In this context a joint is a section of pipe, usually of predetermined length.

LS.longDescription: Often used when a sum is pre-negotiated outside of an order

PER.longDescription: The proportion or share in relation to the whole.

PSI.longDescription: Pressure a gas or liquid exerts on the walls of its container

Q1.longDescription: One of a set of four 3-month divisions of a year

VAR.longDescription: A unit that is used to measure reactive power in AC circuits

ZC.longDescription: One of two 6-month divisions of a year

AllowChrgQty.description: Numeric value of quantity to which the allowance or charge applies[AllowChrgRate, AllowChrgQty, AllowChrgQtyUOM fields should all be sent in conjunction with each other]

AllowChrgHandlingCode.description: Code indicating method of handling for an allowance or charge

05.description: Charge to be paid by vendor

06.description: Charge to be paid by customer[Buying Organization]

09.description: Allowance to be Issued by Vendor
09.longDescription: Code designating vendor as the issuer of an allowance

ReferenceIdentification.description: Provides a specific value as defined by the code used in either the AllowChrgCode or AllowChrgAgency

AllowChrgHandlingDescription.description: Free-form textual description of the allowance or charge
examples: This will cover the cost of shipping

OptionNumber.description: Provides greater context to the ReferenceIdentification when there is more than one option to the charge or allowance

ExceptionNumber.description: Number which identifies an exception to a current charge or allowance

AllowChrgQty2.description: Indicates a quantity range. This is used in conjuction with the AllowChrgQty

LanguageCode.description: Code designating the language used in text. ISO 639 language code

CalculationSequence.description: Used to indicate at what point a value should be used in calculations where orders of operations matter [i.e. 1 would indicate that the related value should be taken first].

TaxTypeCode.description: Identification of the type of duty, tax, or fee applicable to commodities or of tax applicable to services

A.longDescription: A rate where there is a single price for a number of separate supplies of goods or services, but one or all of them are at a different VAT rate

AF.longDescription: Taxes associated with the production or sale of an alcoholic item

AVT.longDescription: Total of all VAT taxes when no further clarification is required

AX.longDescription: Taxes associated with the production or sale of a tobacco laced item

BB.longDescription: Taxed amount, similar to sales tax, for goods purchased outside your taxing authorities jurisdiction paid to your tax authority

BE.longDescription: Combinations of Goods and Services tax and Provincial/State Sales tax

CA.longDescription: City Tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

CE.longDescription: County taxes paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

CP.longDescription: County/Parish tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

CS.longDescription: City tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

EV.longDescription: Taxes on environmental pollutants or on goods whose use produces pollutants

FD.longDescription: Federal Tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

FT.longDescription: Federal taxes paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

GR.longDescription: Tax on the total gross revenues of a company. Similar to a sales tax but levied on the seller of goods

GS.longDescription: Tax on goods purchased and/or services rendered

H215.longDescription: Duty paid in terms of specific amount per unit as defined in a tariff

H535.longDescription: Duties paid on goods in a tariff category that are subjected to a different amount or percent than the other goods in that category

H625.longDescription: Taxes associated with the production or sale of a non-alcoholic item

H640.longDescription: Taxes calculated by destination location, paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

H650.longDescription: Taxes calculated by originating location, paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

H670.longDescription: Taxes paid by the producer or seller of vehicle tires, generally included in list price

H720.longDescription: Money paid to the government for a control or regulated substance

H760.longDescription: State Taxes on materials that are deemed dangerous or harmful that will be used for producing goods

H780.longDescription: Taxes paid by the producer or seller of specific products where any tax revenue generated is designated to fund the cleanup of Superfund sites

HZ.longDescription: Taxes for the disposal of materials that are deemed dangerous or harmful

I431.description: U.S. Customs Service [USCS] Flat Assist Amount
I431.longDescription: Flat amount associated with any import items provided in the use of production or sale of merchandise

LO.longDescription: Local Tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

LS.longDescription: State and Local tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

LT.longDescription: Local tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

QST.longDescription: The tax paid to government of Quebec for the sale of goods and services

S.longDescription: If you are registered for VAT, this is the default rate used

SBSD.longDescription: Amount granted by the government to assist in competitive pricing

SE.longDescription: State taxes paid by the producer or seller of the merchandise, generally included in list price

SL.longDescription: State and Local tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

SP.longDescription: State/Provincial tax with no additional information provided by Trading Partner

SQ.longDescription: Combination of State/Provincial Sales and Quebec Sales [see ST and QST for definitions]

ST.longDescription: State/Provincial tax paid for the sale of certain goods and services

SU.longDescription: Combination of Sales and Use Tax [see SATA and BB for definitions]

SUIP.longDescription: Text description used to provide context for usage

TX.longDescription: Total of all taxes when no further clarification is required

UNDF.longDescription: No additional information provided by Trading Partner

VA.longDescription: Consumption tax where the ultimate tax burden is paid by the end consumer with the benefit of additional accounting mechanisms due to the tax being paid at each transaction stage

Z.longDescription: A rate that is taxable for VAT, but the VAT rate is zero per cent. You can generally reclaim VAT on purchases that are sold as zero-rated goods or services. Zero rates are different than an exemption from VAT

TaxPercentQual.description: Code indicating on what basis a tax percent is calculated

7.description: Base Price Amount Less Previous Discount

TaxPercent.description: The percentage that is applied to determine the tax amount. Percentages should be represented as real numbers[0% through 100% should be normalized to 0.0 through 100.00]

JurisdictionQual.description: Code identifying the source of the data used in the Tax JurisdictionCode

JurisdictionCode.description: Code represents the City, State, or Providence[tax authority] associated with the Tax group

TaxExemptCode.description: Code indicating whether the header or item level data is exempt[or not exempt] for the tax and taxing authority indicated in JurisdictionCode

0.longDescription: Goods exempted from taxes because they are designated for export

RelationshipCode.description: Code identifying whether the tax amount is included in the total transaction amount

PercentDollarBasis.description: Monetary amount that is used when calculating a tax, allowance, or charge amount.

TaxHandlingCode.description: Code indicating method of handling for a tax

05.description: Charge to be paid by vendor

06.description: Charge to be paid by customer[Buying Organization]

TaxID.description: Number assigned to a purchaser[buyer, orderer] by a tax jurisdiction[state, country, etc]

examples: New products only. Do not reuse packaging

SPC.longDescription: Container made up of two parts, typically paper and plastic, where the plastic is formed over the product

67.longDescription: Thicker cardboard often used to protect furniture

UNDF.longDescription: No additional information provided by trading partner

LadingDescription.description: Textual information relating to transported cargo

F.longDescription: Weight artificially added in order to decrease the cost

T.longDescription: The weight of an empty logistical unit

items.description: Indicates that the related item[s] are following the specified government or industry rules regarding material, manufacturing process and or end product

RegulatoryComplianceQual.description: Code indicating the act or legislation

ADA.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act

ASTC.longDescription: Indicates the item can be labeled conductive per American Society for Testing and Materials [ASTM]

ASTD.longDescription: Indicates the item can be labeled static dissipative per American Society for Testing and Materials [ASTM]

ASTE.longDescription: Indicates the item can be labeled electrical hazard resistant per American Society for Testing and Materials [ASTM]

ASTM.longDescription: Indicates the item can be labeled metatarsal per American Society for Testing and Materials [ASTM]

ASTP.longDescription: Indicates the item can be labeled puncture resistant per American Society for Testing and Materials [ASTM]

CAA.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the Clean Air Act

CAEC.longDescription: Yes indicates if the item meets all necessary electrical certifications for Canada.

CAFA0.longDescription: Yes indicates non-compliance with California Air Resources Board [CARB] - Formaldehyde Act [Part 4]

CAFA1.longDescription: Yes indicates phase 1 compliance with California Air Resources Board [CARB] - Formaldehyde Act [Part 4]

CAFA2.longDescription: Yes indicates phase 2 compliance with California Air Resources Board [CARB] - Formaldehyde Act [Part 4]

CAFA3.description: CARB Formaldehyde Act No Added Formaldehyde

CAFA4.description: CARB Formaldehyde Act Ultra Low Emission Formaldehyde Use [ULEF]
CAFA4.longDescription: Yes indicates that Ultra Low Emission Formaldehyde [ULEF] was used per with California Air Resources Board [CARB] - Formaldehyde Act [Part 4]

CANC.longDescription: Yes indicates if the item is a comsemtic item registered with Health Canada.

CE.longDescription: Yes indicates product is certified by the European Union

CERC.description: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act
CERC.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act

CSA.longDescription: Yes indicates product is certified by the Canadian Standards Association

CWA.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the Clean Water Act

DOLFL.description: Compliant with Fair Labor Standards Act
DOLFL.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with US Department Of Labor's Fair Labor Standards Act

DSCSA.longDescription: Yes indicates that this is the Transaction Statement as defined by the Drug Quality and Security Act

EPAES.longDescription: Yes indicates item is compliant with US Environmental Protection Agency's Energy Star program

EPAR.longDescription: Yes indicates that the product is registered with the EPA

EUEHS.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with European Union's Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive 2011/65/EU

FDA.longDescription: Indicates if the item complies with regulations described by the FDA

FHA.longDescription: Yes indicates that the item is approved for use by the Federal Housing Administration

FQA.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the federal Fastener Quality Act

FTCFP.description: Compliant with Fur Products Labeling Act
FTCFP.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with US Federal Trade Commission's Fur Products Labeling Act

FTCTF.description: Compliant with Textile Fiber Product Identification Act and Regulations

FTCWA.description: Compliant with Wool Products Labeling Act
FTCWA.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with US Federal Trade Commission's Wool Products Labeling Act

GNGA.longDescription: Agnecy responsible for inspecting and controlling a particular product type

OGC.longDescription: Yes indicates the product is certified organic by a regulatory organization

SDWA.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the Safe Drinking Water Act

STAEV.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with required State Environment Requirements

TITX.description: Residential Lead-Based Paint Hazard Reduction Act of 1992
TITX.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the Residential Lead-Based Paint Hazard Reduction Act of 1992

TSCA.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with the Toxic Substances Control Act

USDA.longDescription: Indicates if the item has been inspected by and/or complies with USDA regulations

UWLB.longDescription: Indicates if the item has obtained certification from Underwriters Laboratories [UL]

VOORC.longDescription: Yes indicates compliance with required volatile organic compound regulations

WTRS.longDescription: Yes indicates the item has a WaterSense certification issued by the EPA

LineSequenceNumber.description: For an initiated document, this is a unique number for the line item[s]. For a return transaction, this number should be the same as what was received from the source transaction.

ApplicationId.description: ERP generated code to uniquely identify the item

ConsumerPackageCode.description: Consumer level or customer unit product identification number

EAN.description: International Article Number, aka European Article Number, which is the European equivalent of the United States UPC[Universal Product Code]

GTIN.description: Global Trade Item Number which is an item identifier that encompasses all product identification numbers such as UPC, EAN, ITF, etc. and can be assigned at various packing levels

UPCCaseCode.description: Package or case level product identification number

NatlDrugCode.description: National Drug Code or NDC is a unique, universal product identifier for drugs. Primarily used in the pharmaceutical industry

InternationalStandardBookNumber.description: ISBN is a unique number assigned to every book before publication

items.description: Identifies additional product identification numbers which are not defined in designated fields

PartNumberQual.description: Qualifier describing the additional product identification numbers not defined in specific fields at the line level

AR.longDescription: Number assigned to a product as defined by Aeronautical Radio, Incorporated

BPDN.longDescription: The 5 digit permanent identification of a magazine throughout its retail life as assigned by BIPAD

CID.longDescription: A unique identifier for a product that does not have a typical part number. This should be the only product identifier when used

DIN.longDescription: Unique eight digit number assigned and labeled on any prescription or over-the-counter drugs approved for sale in Canada.

DPN.longDescription: Indicates the part number of a product that has been replaced by a new product

PC.longDescription: Number assigned to a product by the primary contractor of a job, which is used by subcontractors working with the primary contractor

PLU.longDescription: Number assigned to a product which is used to make the checkout process easier and more efficient. Typically used with grocery items

RP.longDescription: Indicates the part number that will be used as a substitute for the original ordered part

SS.longDescription: Used to indicate the newest design of a specific part, but maintains the overall functionality of the previous product or part

ZEAN.longDescription: Indicates additional EANs if there are multiple associated with the item. Use only if EAN field is already in use. Not to be used if the additional EAN value represents a different item.

ZGTIN.longDescription: Indicates additional GTINs if there are multiple associated with the item. Use only if GTIN field is already in use. Not to be used if the additional GTIN value represents a different item.

ZISBN.longDescription: An alternate to the primary ISBN number

ZUPC.longDescription: Indicates additional UPCs if there are multiple associated with the item. Use only if ConsumerPackageCode is already in use. Not to be used if the additional UPC value represents a different item.

PurchasePriceType.description: Code identifying the type of price

AAA.longDescription: Final price, includes any discounts, fees or taxes

AAB.longDescription: Final price, not including any discounts fees or taxes

AAE.longDescription: Final price including taxes but excluding any discounts or fees

BLP.longDescription: Price that is used as a starting point between two parties for the purposes of negotiations. This is what is expected to be paid if there are no further negotiations or discounts to be applied

CAT.longDescription: Price with discounts, shipping/handling and tax are included

CON.longDescription: Price listed in a legally binding contract

D01.longDescription: Health care pricing governed by the Federal Supply Schedule (FSS)

DIS.longDescription: Sale price being offered to customer by retailer

ECP.longDescription: Price charged to the end consumer

ELC.longDescription: The total cost of landed goods including purchase price, freight, insurance, and other costs up to the port of destination

EST.longDescription: Price which is based on previous costs or an educated guess. This is different than a quoted price.

FCP.longDescription: Also called Prime Cost. The price of goods that includes all direct costs [material, labor, freight, etc.] but excludes all indirect costs [such as the purchase of equipment]

MSR.longDescription: Price the manufacturer suggests it to be sold at

PNP.longDescription: Final price including adjustments but excluding any taxes

PRP.longDescription: Price that is available for a limited time or in conjunction with other offers

QTE.longDescription: Price listed in a non-legally binding agreement, and may be subject to change

RPC.longDescription: Price the retailer suggests it to be sold at

RTL.longDescription: Price that is printed on the item

TNP.longDescription: Line item Qty * Price including charges, allowances, and taxes

UCP.longDescription: Price retailer pays vendor for goods

VPC.longDescription: Price the vendor or supplier suggests it to be sold at

WHL.longDescription: Price supplier/produce sells to a retailer/buyer, generally less than List Price

PurchasePriceBasis.description: Code specifying the type of unit price for an item

CAD.longDescription: Date the item was added to the trading partner's internal catalog

CSD.longDescription: Date that the contract was signed. May be different from the date the contract comes into effect.

DLO.longDescription: The date and time related to loading cargo

MRB.longDescription: Indicates that the return document must be sent by the provided date or time

OTD.longDescription: The date when ownership of the goods change

POS.longDescription: Used to indicate the date/time that equipment was/must be in position (typically used to communicate when an empty trailer or container must be in position for loading a shipment)

TPD.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is taxed, typically seen with VAT

ItemScheduleDate.description: New or current ship date for the quantity associated with the given status code

ConsumerPackageCode.description: Consumer level or customer unit product identification number

EAN.description: International Article Number, aka European Article Number, which is the European equivalent of the United States UPC[Universal Product Code]

GTIN.description: Global Trade Item Number which is an item identifier that encompasses all product identification numbers such as UPC, EAN, ITF, etc. and can be assigned at various packing levels

UPCCaseCode.description: Package or case level product identification number

NatlDrugCode.description: National Drug Code or NDC is a unique, universal product identifier for drugs. Primarily used in the pharmaceutical industry

InternationalStandardBookNumber.description: ISBN is a unique number assigned to every book before publication

items.description: Identifies additional product identification numbers which are not defined in designated fields

PartNumberQual.description: Qualifier describing the additional product identification numbers not defined in specific fields at the line level

AR.longDescription: Number assigned to a product as defined by Aeronautical Radio, Incorporated

BPDN.longDescription: The 5 digit permanent identification of a magazine throughout its retail life as assigned by BIPAD

CID.longDescription: A unique identifier for a product that does not have a typical part number. This should be the only product identifier when used

DIN.longDescription: Unique eight digit number assigned and labeled on any prescription or over-the-counter drugs approved for sale in Canada.

DPN.longDescription: Indicates the part number of a product that has been replaced by a new product

PC.longDescription: Number assigned to a product by the primary contractor of a job, which is used by subcontractors working with the primary contractor

PLU.longDescription: Number assigned to a product which is used to make the checkout process easier and more efficient. Typically used with grocery items

RP.longDescription: Indicates the part number that will be used as a substitute for the original ordered part

SS.longDescription: Used to indicate the newest design of a specific part, but maintains the overall functionality of the previous product or part

ZEAN.longDescription: Indicates additional EANs if there are multiple associated with the item. Use only if EAN field is already in use. Not to be used if the additional EAN value represents a different item.

ZGTIN.longDescription: Indicates additional GTINs if there are multiple associated with the item. Use only if GTIN field is already in use. Not to be used if the additional GTIN value represents a different item.

ZISBN.longDescription: An alternate to the primary ISBN number

ZUPC.longDescription: Indicates additional UPCs if there are multiple associated with the item. Use only if ConsumerPackageCode is already in use. Not to be used if the additional UPC value represents a different item.

PartNumber.description: Additional product identification numbers not defined in specific fields at the line level

PurchasePriceType.description: Code identifying the type of price

AAA.longDescription: Final price, includes any discounts, fees or taxes

AAB.longDescription: Final price, not including any discounts fees or taxes

AAE.longDescription: Final price including taxes but excluding any discounts or fees

BLP.longDescription: Price that is used as a starting point between two parties for the purposes of negotiations. This is what is expected to be paid if there are no further negotiations or discounts to be applied

CAT.longDescription: Price with discounts, shipping/handling and tax are included

CON.longDescription: Price listed in a legally binding contract

D01.longDescription: Health care pricing governed by the Federal Supply Schedule (FSS)

DIS.longDescription: Sale price being offered to customer by retailer

ECP.longDescription: Price charged to the end consumer

ELC.longDescription: The total cost of landed goods including purchase price, freight, insurance, and other costs up to the port of destination

EST.longDescription: Price which is based on previous costs or an educated guess. This is different than a quoted price.

FCP.longDescription: Also called Prime Cost. The price of goods that includes all direct costs [material, labor, freight, etc.] but excludes all indirect costs [such as the purchase of equipment]

MSR.longDescription: Price the manufacturer suggests it to be sold at

PNP.longDescription: Final price including adjustments but excluding any taxes

PRP.longDescription: Price that is available for a limited time or in conjunction with other offers

QTE.longDescription: Price listed in a non-legally binding agreement, and may be subject to change

RPC.longDescription: Price the retailer suggests it to be sold at

RTL.longDescription: Price that is printed on the item

TNP.longDescription: Line item Qty * Price including charges, allowances, and taxes

UCP.longDescription: Price retailer pays vendor for goods

VPC.longDescription: Price the vendor or supplier suggests it to be sold at

WHL.longDescription: Price supplier/produce sells to a retailer/buyer, generally less than List Price

PurchasePrice.description: Agreed upon price the buyer is paying for the line item

PurchasePriceBasis.description: Code specifying the type of unit price for an item

ExchangeRate.description: The rate to be applied to convert one currency to another

ProductSizeCode.description: Vendor/Buyer assigned size code. NRF codes should go in the NRFStandardColorAndSize fields

ProductSizeDescription.description: Free-form textual description of the product size

ProductColorCode.description: Vendor/Buyer assigned color code. NRF codes should go in the NRFStandardColorAndSize fields

ProductColorDescription.description: Free-form textual description of the product color

ProductMaterialCode.description: Vendor/Buyer assigned fabric code/material code. NRF codes should go in the NRFStandardColorAndSize fields

ProductMaterialDescription.description: Free-form textual description of the item's primary material/fabric

ProductProcessCode.description: Code assigned to the manufacturing process of the product

ProductProcessDescription.description: Description of the manufacturing process of the product

Department.description: Name or number identifying an area wherein merchandise is categorized within a store

DepartmentDescription.description: Free form text to describe the name or number identifying an area wherein merchandise is categorized within a store

Gender.description: Description used to identify the primary gender[and age] for which an item is designed.

IndustryCode.description: Value as defined by the IndustryCodeQualifer

DateTimeQualifier.description: Code specifying the type of date

036.longDescription: Date when something is no longer available/valid

076.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested delivery

077.description: Requested For Delivery Week of Date

087.longDescription: The beginning date of the requested shipment

100.longDescription: The date at which there is no shipment arrival timeline

110.longDescription: The date associated with the initial scheduled ship date

145.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is first available for business

146.longDescription: Date and time when an entity is no longer available for business

209.longDescription: A date on which the funds are at the disposal of the beneficiary or cease to be at the disposal of the ordering customer

371.longDescription: The expected date of receiving a good or service

405.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is created or manufactured

511.longDescription: Date when a product can not be legally sold due to it being unfit for use or consumption

636.longDescription: The most recent date at which an update was made to the transaction

ACT.longDescription: The date at which the document is effective for terms and contractual agreements

BBD.longDescription: Date when a product's optimal use or consumption has lapsed but is still legal for sale

CAD.longDescription: Date the item was added to the trading partner's internal catalog

CSD.longDescription: Date that the contract was signed. May be different from the date the contract comes into effect.

DLO.longDescription: The date and time related to loading cargo

MRB.longDescription: Indicates that the return document must be sent by the provided date or time

OTD.longDescription: The date when ownership of the goods change

POS.longDescription: Used to indicate the date/time that equipment was/must be in position (typically used to communicate when an empty trailer or container must be in position for loading a shipment)

TPD.longDescription: Indicates the date that an item or good is taxed, typically seen with VAT

Time.description: All standard XML formats are accepted.

DateTimePeriod.description: A date, time, or range of dates and times

items.description: Details various systems of measuring and their values

MeasurementQualifier.description: Code identifying a specific product to which a measurement applies

CNSM.longDescription: The amount of consumable contents the item contains

CVOL.longDescription: The amount an item can hold in volume

CWHT.longDescription: The amount an item can hold in weight

DMD.longDescription: Measure of the average rate at which your home or business consumes electricity in a defined time interval

MLFN.longDescription: Denotes the purity of a precious metal alloy by parts per thousand of pure metal by mass in the alloy [i.e a sample that is 75% pure is denoted as 750]

SND.longDescription: The amount of sound an item can produce

MeasurementValue.description: A numerical value associated with MeasurementQualifier

CompositeUOM.description: The unit of measure used in relation to all values in the measurement group

AM.longDescription: A sealed glass capsule containing a liquid

DB.longDescription: Weight of the item when dry.  Qualifier should only be used if distinction is needed between pounds and dry pounds [i.e. pounds of wet cement vs. dry cement]

DD.longDescription: Used to describe angles. This is not to be used to describe temperatures.

DE.longDescription: Equal to 1.375 cubic feet in the United States. Typically used to measure wood

DWT.longDescription: Used in the valuation and measurement of precious metals. Equal to 24 grains, 120 of a troy ounce, and 1.55517384 grams.

FZ.longDescription: Equal to 1/20 of an Imperial Pint, or 28.416 milliliters

JO.longDescription: Usually used for ordering pipe. In this context a joint is a section of pipe, usually of predetermined length.

LS.longDescription: Often used when a sum is pre-negotiated outside of an order

PER.longDescription: The proportion or share in relation to the whole.

PSI.longDescription: Pressure a gas or liquid exerts on the walls of its container

Q1.longDescription: One of a set of four 3-month divisions of a year

VAR.longDescription: A unit that is used to measure reactive power in AC circuits

ZC.longDescription: One of two 6-month divisions of a year

RangeMinimum.description: The lower limit on a particular scale associated with the MeasurementQualifier

RangeMaximum.description: The upper limit on a particular scale associated with the MeasurementQualifier

MeasurementSignificanceCode.description: Code used to qualify or further define a measurement value

IndustryCodeQualifier.description: Code indicating a code from a specific industry code list

IndustryCode.description: Value as defined by the IndustryCodeQualifer

items.description: Details pricing data for the product

AQ.description: Alternate Quantity and Unit Of Measure

EffectiveDate.description: Date in which a price became active

PriceTypeIDCode.description: Code identifying the type of price

AAA.longDescription: Final price, includes any discounts, fees or taxes

AAB.longDescription: Final price, not including any discounts fees or taxes

AAE.longDescription: Final price including taxes but excluding any discounts or fees

BLP.longDescription: Price that is used as a starting point between two parties for the purposes of negotiations. This is what is expected to be paid if there are no further negotiations or discounts to be applied

CAT.longDescription: Price with discounts, shipping/handling and tax are included

CON.longDescription: Price listed in a legally binding contract

D01.longDescription: Health care pricing governed by the Federal Supply Schedule (FSS)

DIS.longDescription: Sale price being offered to customer by retailer

ECP.longDescription: Price charged to the end consumer

ELC.longDescription: The total cost of landed goods including purchase price, freight, insurance, and other costs up to the port of destination

EST.longDescription: Price which is based on previous costs or an educated guess. This is different than a quoted price.

FCP.longDescription: Also called Prime Cost. The price of goods that includes all direct costs [material, labor, freight, etc.] but excludes all indirect costs [such as the purchase of equipment]

PNP.longDescription: Final price including adjustments but excluding any taxes

PRP.longDescription: Price that is available for a limited time or in conjunction with other offers
